cv.introduction: Here's the most relevant parts of my professional career as a timeline. If you're looking for a more traditional CV, {0} for the PDF version.

AIMasters.title: Masters in Artificial Intelligence Research
AIMasters.shortDescription: Education in machine learning, artificial intelligence, statistics and data analysis, and introduction to scientific research.

ITDegree.title: Degree in Computer Science
ITDegree.shortDescription: Advanced education related to computer science, included but not limited to: software programming and design, systems engineering and systems administration.

citius.title: Researcher / Software Developer
citius.shortDescription: Full stack development with a strong focus on Android. Research in medication adherence and mHealth. Main project: Calendula.

everis.title: Programmer
everis.shortDescription: Internship as a software developer. Mainly Java EE (Spring) with some tasks in Android.

imagames.title: Frontend Developer / DevOps Engineer
imagames.shortDescription: DevOps and VueJS frontend, with some occasional tasks in Scala backend and Android applications.

machineLearning.title: Machine Learning
machineLearning.shortDescription: Machine Learning  course imparted by prof. Andrew Ng of Stanford University on Coursera. Both theoretical and practical assignments on neural networks, SVMs and other fundamental Machine Learning algorithms and related skills.

scalaFP.title: Functional Programming in Scala
scalaFP.shortDescription: Introductory course to Scala and higher level functional programming concepts.

cv.title: My CV

index.interests: I am passionate about automatization and clean code. As a consequence, I am very interested in strongly automated development processes (CI/CD), code reviews, and other ways to improve code quality.
index.introduction: I am a software engineer from Santiago de Compostela, Spain. I mainly do DevOps and VueJS frontend, but I have experience and training in other areas and technologies.
